English (United States)(en-US): Humans have a round head, flat\nbody, long stick-like arms and legs,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간은 동그란 머리 하나와 판판한 몸, \n기다란 선 같은 팔다리를 가지고 있는데,

English (United States)(en-US): and at the end of each limb are no more than\nfive fingers and toes, flexing intricately.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그 팔다리 네 개 끝에는 정교하게 꼬물거리는\n손발가락들이 무려 다섯 개나 달려 있어.

English (United States)(en-US): And they grow loooong hair to\nprotect their advanced brain.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 또 기이다란 머리털이 그들의\n고등한 뇌를 지키기 위해 자라나지.

English (United States)(en-US): And here’s the really truly incredible part!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리고 정말로 정말로 놀라운 부분은!

English (United States)(en-US): Humans are colorful.\nJust like the dreams they have!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간은 ‘색’이 아주 많다는 거야.\n그들이 꾸는 꿈처럼 말이야!

English (United States)(en-US): Hair, eyes, skin, all contain\ncolor like individual traces.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 머리칼에도, 눈동자에도, 피부에도,\n각자만의 흔적 같은 색을 품고 있지.

English (United States)(en-US): The color of a young leaf, a clear sky,\nand your own skin is certainly beautiful.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 흐드러지는 풀잎의 색, 선선한 하늘의 색,\n그리고 네 가죽의 색도 아름답지만.

English (United States)(en-US): But I heard the colors of humans\nare inimitably beautiful.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간의 색은 그와는 비교할\n수 없이 아름답다고 들었어.

English (United States)(en-US): And I hear they add layers of unborn\ncolors with cloth and accessories!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 또 천이나 장식으로 피부를 덮어, 가지고\n태어나지 않은 색들도 마음껏 덧칠하고는 한대!

English (United States)(en-US): From what Red has told me…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 레드의 말을 취합해서\n유추해 본 결과…

English (United States)(en-US): Humans… look like this!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간들은… 이렇게 생겼어!

English (United States)(en-US): He said showing this would work. That only\nhumans have such a wonderful exterior.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이걸 보여 주면 알 거라고 했어. 이렇게\n멋진 외형을 가진 건 인간밖에 없다고 했거든.

English (United States)(en-US): Have you ever seen a real human too?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너도 인간을 실제로 본 적이 있니?

English (United States)(en-US): (Huh?)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (어라?)

English (United States)(en-US): (What is this?)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (이게 대체 뭐지?)

English (United States)(en-US): Well… you make me blush.\nSince I’m human?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그… 쑥스럽네. 내가 인간인걸?

English (United States)(en-US): You’re human?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 네가 인간이라고?

English (United States)(en-US): … There’s no way.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): … 말도 안 돼.

English (United States)(en-US): It’s true.|Take it or leave it!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 정말이야.|믿거나 말거나!

English (United States)(en-US): Humans. Round head… two arms…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간의 특성. 동그란\n머리… 팔 두 개….

English (United States)(en-US): Two legs… flat body…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 다리 두 개… 판판한 몸통….

English (United States)(en-US): Color…ful. Oh?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 색깔이 많… 다. 어라?

English (United States)(en-US): Do you read words made\nof squiggly letters?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너, 네모반듯하게 짜인\n문자로 된 글을 읽니?

English (United States)(en-US): Well, of course.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그럼, 당연하지.

English (United States)(en-US): And do you sing beautiful tunes?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너도 아름다운 노래를 하니?

English (United States)(en-US): I don’t know about\nbeautiful but I can sing.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아름다운지는 모르겠지만\n노래를 하지.

English (United States)(en-US): And do you hmmm when you’re lost in thought?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너도 고민에 잠겼을 때 가만히 ‘음’\n같은 소리를 내기도 하니?

English (United States)(en-US): Hmm… oh? I guess I do!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 음… 어라? 그런 것 같아!

English (United States)(en-US): Unbelievable.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 말도 안 돼.

English (United States)(en-US): Unbelievable!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 말도 안 돼!

English (United States)(en-US): I met a human! I did it? I did it!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인 간을 만났어! 만났어? 만난 거야!

English (United States)(en-US): <nickname>, everyone on\nthe moon loves you!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>, 달에 있는\n모두가 너를 사랑해!

English (United States)(en-US): Human! Hu-man! HUMAN!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간! 인 간! 인간이야!

English (United States)(en-US): Human <nickname>, my body pounds and my\nheart swivels, it’s just that nice to meet you.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간 <nickname>, 몸이 콩콩 뛰고\n심장이 빙글 돌아갈 것처럼 반가워.

English (United States)(en-US): How does one on Earth call\nthe color I see on your hair?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너의 이 머리카락에서 보여지는\n색은 지구에서 뭐라고 불려?

English (United States)(en-US): That would be……
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내 머리의 색은……

English (United States)(en-US): I see! I won’t ever forget!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇구나! 결코 잊지 않을게!

English (United States)(en-US): Oh, oh, oh! <nickname>, I’m a blobby creature\nborn on the dark side of the Moon!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 아, 아, 아! <nickname>, 나는 달 뒤편에서 태어난 덩어리 괴물!

English (United States)(en-US): I opened my eyes in a puddle of\nFilth from the dream factory,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 비록 꿈 공장의 폐기물\n웅덩이 속에서 눈을 떴지만,

English (United States)(en-US): but the first things that these eyes saw were\ndream marbles, iridescent and glowing.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): body_default1

English (United States)(en-US): And though I have a unpleasant\nsticky body for the moment…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 지금은 불쾌하고 끈적한\n몸을 가지고 있지만…

English (United States)(en-US): I know that one day I will become\na beautiful dream of a human!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 언젠가는 인간의 아름다운\n꿈이 될 것이라는 확신이 있어!

English (United States)(en-US): I don’t, actually… Nothing is certain and even\nin bliss I find myself wrapped in despair
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 실은 없어…. 아무것도 확실한 게 없어서\n환희 속에서도 절망에 휘어감기는 나지만

English (United States)(en-US): but my hopes are unshaken.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 소망만은 확고해.

English (United States)(en-US): So… So…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그러니까… 그러니까….

English (United States)(en-US): Could I ask a favor of you?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 너에게 부탁을 하나 해도 될까?

English (United States)(en-US): Which… would be…?|Yes, what is it?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭔… 데…?|응, 뭔데?

English (United States)(en-US): Hmm, hmm, hem, hem!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 음, 음, 흠, 흠!

English (United States)(en-US): I, I, I want to become the best dream for\nhumans. Tell me everything about them!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나, 나, 인간을 위한 최고의 꿈이 되고\n싶어. 인간에 대한 모든 걸 알려줘!

English (United States)(en-US): I want take place in any old dusty\ncorner and observe you from behind.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 어디서나 먼지 내려앉은 구석에 틀어박혀\n너의 뒷모습을 관찰하고 싶어.

English (United States)(en-US): Let me record each and every vibrant\nmoment by your side always.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 언제나 너의 곁에 함께하면서 생동하는\n모든 순간을 기록하게 해 줘.

English (United States)(en-US): I want to make you, human, happy!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간인 너를 행복하게 해 주고 싶어!

English (United States)(en-US): Hold on.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 잠깐만.

English (United States)(en-US): From henceforth I’ll be with you like\na sticky shadow! Forever and always!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이제부터는 끈적한 그림자처럼\n내가 함께할게! 항상, 항상!

English (United States)(en-US): Hold on…!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 잠깐만…!

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, yes?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 응?

English (United States)(en-US): (24-hour surveillance is too much.)|(That’s nice, but I’m just one human, right?)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (24시간 붙어 있는 건 부담스럽다.)|(감동이지만 난 인간의 전부가 아닌 걸?)

English (United States)(en-US): Being around each other\nall the time would be difficult.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 항상 붙어 다니는 건 조금 무리야.

English (United States)(en-US): Humans respect each\nother’s privacy, you see.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간에게는 각자의 오붓한 공간을\n존중해 주는 문화가 있거든.

English (United States)(en-US): So it would be too much to\nobserve me every single day.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그래서 매일매일 나를 관찰하는\n건 무리일 수 있지만.

English (United States)(en-US): There is so much more\nout there than just me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 세상에는 나 말고도\n여러 군상이 있는 걸?

English (United States)(en-US): If you want to learn everything about\nhumans… I think you’ll need more than me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치가 인간의 전부를 알고 싶은 거라면…\n나만으로는 부족하지 않을까.

English (United States)(en-US): You want to know about\nhumans as a whole, right?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): ‘인간’ 자체가 궁금한 거지?

English (United States)(en-US): Then observing more humans\nwould be one way of doing that.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그렇다면 보다 많은 사람을\n관찰하는 것도 하나의 방법일 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Such as exploring the world outside…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 바깥을 탐험한다거나….

English (United States)(en-US): I understand what you mean.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 무슨 뜻인지 알겠어.

English (United States)(en-US): But… I don’t think I’m meant to roam.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만… 내 적성은\n방랑자가 아닌 것 같아.

English (United States)(en-US): On the moon, my favorite spots were the\npalm of Red’s hand and Sir Cello’s plump belly.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 달에서 지낼 때에도 나는 레드의 손바닥 안과\n첼로 경의 뱃살 위에 머무는 것을 가장 좋아했어.

English (United States)(en-US): The world outside looks dangerous. No\nsecluded darkness to welcome me.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 바깥은 위험해 보여. 창문 밖엔 나를 품어\n줄 비좁은 어둠이 없는 것 같았어.

English (United States)(en-US): But I… I can’t live without it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 하지만 나에게는… 그게 필요해.

English (United States)(en-US): Oh, I see. You need shelter.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 안식처가 필요한 거구나.

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, that’s it. As long as I’m not\nbothering you, <nickname>.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 응. <nickname>의 방해꾼이\n되고 싶지는 않지만…

English (United States)(en-US): Hmm.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 흠.

English (United States)(en-US): (I’m growing fond of Dot.|(Oh, well…)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (안쓰럽고 귀엽다.)|(그렇다면…)

English (United States)(en-US): And, and.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 그리고, 그리고…

English (United States)(en-US): To say goodbye to the\nfirst human I’ve ever met.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 내가 처음 만난 인간과\n영영 작별해야 한다니.

English (United States)(en-US): Dot…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치야…

English (United States)(en-US): You’re the first alien creature\nI’ve ever met too.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치도 내가 처음\n만난 외계 괴물이야.

English (United States)(en-US): (An alien in my room… I’m a little worried.)|(Friends with an alien… could be interesting!)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (이종족이 내 방에… 조금은 걱정돼.)|(이종족과의 우정이라니… 흥미로워!)

English (United States)(en-US): (But so far no signs of turning into a\nmuscular monster with too much teeth.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (하지만 이빨이 많이 달린 근육\n괴물로 변할 것 같아 보이진 않지.)

English (United States)(en-US): (I’ll give Dot a place to stay,\nand spend some time together.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (일단 지낼 곳을 내어 주고,\n함께 시간을 보내 보자.)

English (United States)(en-US): (Giving Dot a place to stay and spending\ntime together should be fun.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (지낼 곳을 내어 주고 함께 시간을\n보내면 분명 재미있을 것 같아.)

English (United States)(en-US): Alright, Dot.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 좋아, 뭉치.

English (United States)(en-US): I wouldn’t want you to roam the\ndangerous city with no place to go,
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 나도 네가 갈 곳도 없이\n위험천만한 도시를 헤매다,

English (United States)(en-US): and get trampled by people’s shoes without\nbeing able to lift a finger… (if you have one.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 움직일 힘도 없이 구두 밑창에 밟히며\n고통받게 되는 건 보고 싶지 않아.

English (United States)(en-US): How about you observe humans out there,\nand return to the closet once you’re done?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 밖에서 인간들을 관찰하되, 외출을 마치면\n내 장롱으로 돌아오는 걸로 하면 어때?

English (United States)(en-US): Just how did you come up\nwith a plan like that?
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): <nickname>은 어떻게 그런\n방법을 생각해 낸 거야?

English (United States)(en-US): Humans go out, and come home\nall the time. We call it taking a walk.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 인간들은 자주 외출하고, 늘 집으로\n돌아오거든. 우리는 그걸 산책이라 불러.

English (United States)(en-US): Walk, walk, walk.\nAnd my very own corner.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 산책, 산책, 산책.\n그리고 근사한 나의 공간.

English (United States)(en-US): Life couldn’t be better!
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 이보다 좋을 수는 없어!

English (United States)(en-US): (It’s nice to see Dot so happy.)|(I think that worked.)
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): (좋아하는 걸 보니 뿌듯해.)|(잘 넘긴 것 같다.)

English (United States)(en-US): It will help your human studies,\nand I’ll have a little companion…
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 뭉치의 인간 공부에도 도움이 되고,\n나에게도 작은 말동무가 생길 테니…

English (United States)(en-US): This will work for both of us.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 서로에게 좋은 일일 거야.

English (United States)(en-US): Yes, yes. I’m certain of it.
Korean (South Korea)(ko-KR): 응, 응. 분명 그럴 거야!
